org.apache.flex.swf.io

Class OutputBitStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.swf.io.OutputBitStream

  • public class OutputBitStream
extends Object
    The output stream that can write SWF primitive data types. It contains an in-memory buffer. The buffer is optionally compressed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OutputBitStream()
      Create an uncompressed OutputBitStream.
      OutputBitStream(boolean useCompression)
      Create an OutputBitStream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OutputBitStream

        public OutputBitStream()
        Create an uncompressed OutputBitStream.

      • OutputBitStream

        public OutputBitStream(boolean useCompression)
        Create an OutputBitStream.
        Parameters:
        useCompression - true if the output stream is compressed.

    • Method Detail

      • getBitPos

        public int getBitPos()
        Get the value of the current bit position
        Returns:
        current bit position

      • byteAlign

        public void byteAlign()
        Write the bit values in bit buffer onto the output stream. Always call this method in after writing bit values and before writing other byte-aligned data types.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Close internal output buffer.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flush piped output stream. Calling this method automatically flushes bit buffer.

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        Get the direct byte buffer. The buffer size may be larger than the actual number of bytes buffered. Call size() to get the effective byte array size.
        Returns:
        all the bytes in the buffer.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Remove all data in the buffer.

      • size

        public int size()
        Get size of the current buffer.
        Returns:
        number of bytes in the current buffer.

      • toByteArray

        public byte[] toByteArray()
        Get the bytes in the final output stream. This method create a copy of the buffer.
        Returns:
        a copy of buffered bytes in the output stream.

      • write

        public void write(byte[] data)
        Writes data.length bytes from the specified byte array to this stream.
        Parameters:
        data - raw bytes

      • write

        public void write(byte[] data,
         int off,
         int len)
        Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this output stream.
        Parameters:
        data - raw bytes
        off - offset
        len - length

      • writeBit

        public void writeBit(boolean data)
        Write a boolean value as UB[1].
        Parameters:
        data - boolean value

      • writeDOUBLE

        public void writeDOUBLE(double value)
        Write double-precision (64-bit) IEEE Standard 754 compatible. The IEEE 754 standard defines a double as: Sign bit: 1 bit Exponent width: 11 bits Significant precision: 52 bits (53 implicit)
        Parameters:
        value - number

      • writeEncodedU32

        public void writeEncodedU32(long value)
        Write variable length encoded 32-bit unsigned integer.
        Parameters:
        value - integer number

      • writeFB

        public void writeFB(double data,
           int size)
        Write fixed-point bit value.
        Parameters:
        data - float number
        size - number of bits used

      • writeFIXED

        public void writeFIXED(double value)
        Write 32-bit 16.16 fixed-point number.
        Parameters:
        value - float number

      • writeFIXED8

        public void writeFIXED8(double value)
        Write 16-bit 8.8 fixed-point number.
        Parameters:
        value - number

      • writeFLOAT

        public void writeFLOAT(float value)
        Write single-precision (32-bit) IEEE Standard 754 compatible. The IEEE 754 standard specifies a binary32 as having: Sign bit: 1 bit Exponent width: 8 bits Significant precision: 24 (23 explicitly stored)
        Parameters:
        value - number

        Parameters:

        public void writeUI32(long value)
        Write unsigned 32-bit integer value.
        Parameters:
        value - Use signed 64-bit long. The high 32 bits are ignored.
